“(c) The Board shall meet at such times as it shall
determine but not less than four times each year. A quorum
shall consist of six members.
“(d) The Board is authorized to employ such profes¬
sional, technical, clerical, and other assistants, and to utilize
such uncompensated services, as it deems necessary. No em¬
ployee of such Board shall be financially interested in broad¬
casting activities. The budgeting, accounting, procurement,
and related routine management functions of the Board shall
be performed through the Federal Communications Com¬
mission. The Federal Communications Commission and the
Office of Education, Department of Health, Education, and
Welfare, are authorized and directed to furnish to the Board
such records, information, statistics, data, and other infor¬
mation in their possession as the Board may request.
“(e) The Board shall make a continuing study of pro¬
graming trends of broadcasting stations with particular
reference to—
“ (1) the manner in which broadcasting stations
attempt to ascertain the needs of their communities and
their efforts in serving those needs;
“(2) the extent to which broadcasting stations are
carrying programs designed to broaden the civic, edu¬
cational, and cultural interests of the American people,
